intro: Nanocnide pilosa, commonly known as the hairy nanocnide, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
